intro: Waitzia dasycarpa, commonly known as the rough-seeded waitzia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and small, yellowish flowers. Its fruits are capsules that are typically covered in a dense layer of short, stiff hairs. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and potential ecological role in its native habitat.
